The set system forwarding-engine alarm-first command configures the device to only generate an alarm in case of faults.
The undo set system forwarding-engine alarm-first command restores the default configuration. The set system forwarding-engine alarm-first command configures the device to only generate an alarm in case of faults. The undo set system forwarding-engine alarm-first command restores the default configuration. By default, an alarm is generated and the device or board is reset in case of faults.
ExtraInfo: You can configure different actions for forwarding chip events. If the alarm-first function is disabled and related major failures occur, the corresponding board restarts according to the handling policy. If the alarm-first function is enabled and related major failures occur, an alarm is generated, but the corresponding board does not restart.
